department: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
description: The Department of Fisheries & Oceans has a requirement to procure a high precision saw to process Large Pelagic species fin spines and otoliths.
full_summary:
**Government Tender Announcement**
================================

### Background and Scope

The Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) requires the procurement of a high precision saw to process large pelagic species fin spines and otoliths. The acquisition will support ongoing research and conservation efforts for these species.

### Tender Details

* **Tender Number:** WS4388745839
* **Title (English):** F5261-230145 - High Precision Saw
* **Title (French):** F5261-230145 - Scie de haute précision
* **Publication Date:** January 15, 2024
* **Tender Closing Date:** February 20, 2024 @ 14:00:00
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** February 26, 2024 (subject to change)
* **Expected Contract End Date:** None
* **Tender Status:** Expired (not open for new bids)

### Bidder Information

The tender is open for contractors who meet the specifications outlined in the solicitation document. Eligible bidders must be Canadian, as per the included trade agreements (Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement and Canadian Free Trade Agreement).

### Contracting Agent

* **Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)**
* **Address:** 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec, K1A 0S5
* **Contact:** Art Rice, PSPC (art.rice@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

### Specifications and Deliverables

* **High Precision Saw:** The contractor must provide a high precision saw capable of cutting and processing large pelagic species fin spines and otoliths.
* **Laboratory and Scientific Equipment:** The required equipment falls under the UNSPSC category 41100000: Laboratory and scientific equipment.

### Submission Guidelines

Tender submissions must be made according to the attached solicitation document. Late submissions will not be accepted. The contracting agent reserves the right to change the expected contract dates or cancel the tender at its discretion.

### Contact

For more information, please contact Art Rice at art.rice@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca. Access the tender document at the following URL: https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18515352?extsite=MTg1MTUzNTJfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==.
